item.title: Queen Margrethe II: Danish monarch announces abdication live on TV
item.description: Margrethe II, who has reigned for half a century, will step down to be replaced by her son.

item.title: Justin Welby: Political leaders should treat opponents as human beings
item.description: The Archbishop of Canterbury urges politicians to "forswear wedge issues" and avoid divisive topics.

item.title: Cancer: Almost three million tested in England
item.description: Record numbers are being tested for cancer but treatment targets are still being missed in England.

item.title: Household energy price rise of 5% comes into force
item.description: A higher cap for the next three months adds £94 to the typical annual domestic energy bill.

item.title: Family 'heartbroken' after mother and son die in avalanche
item.description: Kate Vokes, 54, and her son Archie, 22, were killed in an avalanche near Mont Blanc in the French Alps.

item.title: Vladimir Putin makes little mention of Ukraine in new year speech
item.description: The Russian president hailed soldiers as heroes, but didn't directly mention the war in Ukraine.

item.title: US Navy helicopters destroy Houthi boats in Red Sea after attempted hijack
item.description: The US military says it responded after a vessel came under attack near Yemen twice in 24 hours.

item.title: Scotland sees in 2024 with fireworks and song
item.description: Tens of thousands watch fireworks explode over Edinburgh's skyline as a New Year begins.

item.title: Singer Lewis Capaldi extends tour break after health improves
item.description: The singer said he was working to improve symptoms caused by Tourette's Syndrome and anxiety.

item.title: Luke Littler v Brendan Dolan: Teenager 'daring to dream' of World Championship glory
item.description: Luke Littler says he is "daring to dream" of winning the PDC World Darts Championship as the 16-year-old prepares to face Northern Ireland's Brendan Dolan in the quarter-finals.

item.title: Spanish football fan held in Tehran released, Iran says
item.description: Santiago Sánchez was detained during a trek in 2022 to the men's football World Cup in Qatar.

item.title: Hogmanay fireworks see in new year in Edinburgh
item.description: Tens of thousands of revellers have taken part in the celebrations.

item.title: The Papers: UK 'ready to attack Houthis' and plan for passport-free travel
item.description: The lead stories include a UK vow to repel Houthi Red Sea attacks and bring in passport-free travel plans.

item.title: 'I was a gambling addict who stole £1.3m and went to prison'
item.description: Andy May, who has just got out of prison, wants to help other people with gambling addictions.

item.title: BBC Sound Of 2024: Soul sensation Elmiene kicks off the countdown
item.description: Velvety smooth vocals and unabashedly intimate songs make the Oxford crooner one to watch in 2024.

item.title: Who is Frederik, the next king of Denmark once nicknamed 'Pingo'?
item.description: "I don't want to lock myself in a fortress. I want to be myself," Crown Prince Frederik once said.

item.title: Queen Margrethe II: Danish monarch's 52-year reign in pictures
item.description: 83-year-old Margrethe II is Europe's longest-serving living monarch, having taken the throne in 1972.

item.title: Post Office scandal TV drama 'like a dream' say victims
item.description: Horizon victims hope a new mini-series will give their story the "oxygen it deserves".

item.title: Brics: What is the group and which countries are joining?
item.description: Brics aims to give emerging nations more power in world affairs, and more countries are joining.

item.title: Kiri Pritchard-Mclean and Rachel Fairburn talk serial killers
item.description: Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Rachel Fairburn share an interested in all things strange and macabre.

item.title: Inside Russia as war in Ukraine grinds into new year
item.description: The BBC's Steve Rosenberg looks at life in a town near Moscow, and asks residents about the war.

item.title: Tom Wilkinson's career in pictures: The Full Monty, Shakespeare in Love, Rush Hour and more
item.description: His credits ranged from British films like The Full Monty to Hollywood hits like Rush Hour.

item.title: New Year celebrations: How the world is welcoming 2024
item.description: People around the world gather to celebrate the new year, with fireworks shows in major cities.

item.title: Mason: Get ready - general election talk will dominate 2024
item.description: A new year, and all the political parties are focusing their planning and attention on the polls ahead.

item.title: Kai Zhuang: Police in Utah say student feared kidnapped may be 'camping'
item.description: Police in Utah initially feared that missing Chinese student Kai Zhuang, 17, had been kidnapped.

item.title: Cairngorms climber lost in blizzard stretchered to safety
item.description: The climber had become separated from their group amid freezing temperatures and heavy snowfall.

item.title: John Pilger: Campaigning Australian journalist dies
item.description: Also a filmmaker, he was a vocal critic of Western foreign policy throughout his career.

item.title: Venice to ban large tourist groups and loudspeakers
item.description: The new rules will come into effect in June and are part of an effort to ease the impact of tourism.

item.title: DR Congo election: President Felix Tshisekedi declared landslide winner
item.description: Officials say Félix Tshisekedi wins a landslide 73% of the vote, while the opposition calls for a rerun.

item.title: Tom Lockyer: Luton captain will meet specialists in new year to determine future in football
item.description: Luton captain Tom Lockyer will meet specialists in the new year to determine his future in football after a cardiac arrest.

item.title: Vogue model Ellie Goldstein: 'Doctors said I wouldn't walk or talk'
item.description: Model Ellie Goldstein, who has Down's syndrome, says people should never give up on their dreams.

item.title: Dominic Cummings: Sunak wanted me to secretly work on election strategy
item.description: Rishi Sunak twice met the former No 10 adviser to discuss campaigns, Downing Street says.

item.title: Benjamin Kiplagat: Ugandan athlete stabbed to death in Kenya - reports
item.description: Benjamin Kiplagat, 34, reached the semi-finals of the 2012 London Olympics in the 3,000m steeplechase.

item.title: Midlands pub closes after fifth flooding
item.description: Staff cancel the bookings of around 200 customers as the pub shuts for the foreseeable future.

item.title: Eurostar services resume after major disruption
item.description: Many passengers are still stranded in London and Paris after flooding cancelled all Eurostar trains.

item.title: Nigel Lythgoe denies abusing Paula Abdul as sexual assault lawsuit looms
item.description: The American singer alleges multiple instances of assault while the pair worked together, which Mr Lythgoe denies.

item.title: Fulham 2-1 Arsenal: 'Lost' Gunners 'need a new striker' in January transfer window
item.description: After Arsenal's 2-1 defeat at Fulham, manager Mikel Arteta claimed they would not need new signings in January. The truth may be quite different.

item.title: Spurs 'show a bit of everything' to beat Bournemouth
item.description: Tottenham finish 2023 on a high with victory over Bournemouth in the Premier League at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.

item.title: Premiership: Leicester 35-22 Bath - Tigers end year with bonus-point win
item.description: Leicester end 2023 by beating a much-changed Bath side, who miss the chance to go top of the Premiership.

item.title: January transfer window: Who could be on the move?
item.description: The January transfer window is open and several players have been linked with a move to and from Premier League clubs.

item.title: Match of the Day 2 analysis: What's wrong at Arsenal?
item.description: Match of the Day 2 pundits Nedum Onuoha and Paul Robinson analyse how Fulham stopped Arsenal from going top of the Premier League.

item.title: Match of the Day 2 Good 2 Bad: Mauricio Pochettino, silky skills and ponchos
item.description: Watch 2 Good 2 Bad from Match of the Day 2, featuring some silky skills, poncho problems and a "mickey-taking mouse".

item.title: United Cup: Katie Boulter beats Jessica Pegula in GB defeat by US
item.description: GB's Katie Boulter records the best win of her career by beating American world number five Jessica Pegula at the United Cup in Perth.

item.title: How to get a job: Six expert tips for finding work
item.description: There are 10m people out of work in the UK, so if you're searching for a job you're not alone. Here are some tips on how to get started.

item.title: Energy prices: How much will you pay from January?
item.description: Use our interactive calculator to find out how much more you'll be paying for energy each month.

item.title: Mortgage rates: Five ways to save money
item.description: Experts give advice for those who might be worried about their monthly mortgage payments.

item.title: Food prices: How can I save money on my grocery shop?
item.description: The cost-of-living crisis continues to bite. Here are some things that can reduce the impact.

item.title: The best way to de-ice a car and other winter tips
item.description: Much of the UK is facing another cold snap amid rising fuel costs.

item.title: How to save money even when the budget is tight
item.description: The interest paid on savings is better than anything seen for years, so how can you save when bills are rising?

item.title: Cost-of-living payments: What are they, who gets them and are they fair?
item.description: Millions of low-income households will receive a final cost-of-living payment in February.

item.title: Rent increases: What you can do about a rise from your landlord
item.description: The BBC's Lora Jones tells you four things you can do, if your landlord asks for more money.

item.title: Buy now, pay later: Things you need to know about the loan schemes
item.description: With the winter sales season in full swing here's what you need to know before borrowing money.

item.title: Energy bills: What can I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: If you're struggling to afford your gas and electricity bills, what options are available?

item.title: Debt: What should I pay first and what can I do?
item.description: What help and options are available to people struggling with debt repayments?

item.title: What a falling inflation rate means for your finances
item.description: Falling inflation and rising wages ease cost of living pressures for some, but money is still very tight.

item.title: What are my rights if my flight is cancelled or delayed?
item.description: Technical glitches have caused disruption at airports but passengers do have rights.

item.title: Energy saving tips: Five ways to cut costs this winter
item.description: Energy prices will be lower this winter than last - but you may be able to save even more on your bill.
